briefdescription.para: Creates a new mutex using the function supplied to dbus_threads_init(), or creates a no-op mutex if threads are not initialized.

detaileddescription.para: May return NULL even if threads are initialized, indicating out-of-memory.

briefdescription.para: Frees a mutex created with dbus_mutex_new(); does nothing if passed a NULL pointer.

detaileddescription.para: Does nothing if passed a NULL pointer. Locks may be recursive if threading implementation initialized recursive locks.
Does nothing if passed a NULL pointer.

briefdescription.para: This does the same thing as _dbus_mutex_new.

detaileddescription.para: It however gives another level of indirection by allocating a pointer to point to the mutex location. This allows the threading module to swap out dummy mutexes for real a real mutex so libraries can initialize threads even after the D-Bus API has been used.

parameterdescription.para: the location of the new mutex, can return NULL on OOM

briefdescription.para: Frees a mutex and removes it from the uninitialized_mutex_list; does nothing if passed a NULL pointer.
Creates a new condition variable using the function supplied to dbus_threads_init(), or creates a no-op condition variable if threads are not initialized.

detaileddescription.para: May return NULL even if threads are initialized, indicating out-of-memory.

briefdescription.para: Frees a conditional variable created with dbus_condvar_new(); does nothing if passed a NULL pointer.
Atomically unlocks the mutex and waits for the conditions variable to be signalled.

detaileddescription.para: Locks the mutex again before returning. Does nothing if passed a NULL pointer.

briefdescription.para: Atomically unlocks the mutex and waits for the conditions variable to be signalled, or for a timeout.

detaileddescription.para: Locks the mutex again before returning. Does nothing if passed a NULL pointer. Return value is FALSE if we timed out, TRUE otherwise.

simplesect.para: FALSE if the timeout occurred, TRUE if not

briefdescription.para: If there are threads waiting on the condition variable, wake up exactly one.

detaileddescription.para: Does nothing if passed a NULL pointer.

briefdescription.para: If there are threads waiting on the condition variable, wake up all of them.

detaileddescription.para: Does nothing if passed a NULL pointer.

briefdescription.para: This does the same thing as _dbus_condvar_new.

detaileddescription.para: It however gives another level of indirection by allocating a pointer to point to the condvar location. This allows the threading module to swap out dummy condvars for real a real condvar so libraries can initialize threads even after the D-Bus API has been used.

simplesect.para: the location of a new condvar or NULL on OOM

briefdescription.para: Frees a conditional variable and removes it from the uninitialized_condvar_list; does nothing if passed a NULL pointer.

ref.tooltip: Macro used prior to declaring functions in the D-Bus header files.
Macro used after declaring functions in the D-Bus header files.
